cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 90 mi SW of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn N-NW today, cross or skirt western Cuba tonight, move northward into the east-central Gulf, then curve NNE toward Florida’s west coast mid-week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida west coast (Englewood–Anclote River/Tampa Bay area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch Englewood to Anclote River (west coast of FL); Tropical Storm Watch Englewood south to Chokoloskee
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane & Tropical Storm Warnings in effect for Grand Cayman, western Cuba, Dry Tortugas and lower Florida Keys (not east coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida peninsula, especially west coast for surge/wind; east-central coast (including Port Canaveral) likely to experience tropical-storm conditions and heavy rain mid- to late-week
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) possible late Wednesday into Thursday; 20 % chance of 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None (significant surge threat focused on Florida west coast; only minor coastal inundation possible on Atlantic side).
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–8 inches of rain possible across east-central Florida with locally higher amounts; flash and urban flooding possible.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado risk beginning late Tuesday night; dangerous surf and rip currents along the Space Coast mid-week.
